definition: lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face

sentences.english: Comes face to face with an adversary the brave victory, now judges true brave to be also too early.
sentences.chinese: 狭路相逢勇者胜，现在来判断真正的勇者还为时过早。

sentences.english: It opens on the narrow path toward racial fascism.
sentences.chinese: 这样的定义，开辟了通向种族法西斯主义的狭路。

sentences.english: The Opposition speaker accused the British Government of leading the country up the garden path on the question of civil defence.
sentences.chinese: 反对党发言人指责英国政府把国家领上了一条狭路。

sentences.english: A part of little width, as a pass through mountains.
sentences.chinese: 狭路，隘路狭窄部分，如穿山小径。

sentences.english: They drove down a narrow track that branched off from the main road.
sentences.chinese: 他们驶入一条从干道分叉的小狭路。

sentences.english: In a darkened hangar, the two confronted Dooku.
sentences.chinese: 在一个光线阴暗的机库中，两人与杜库狭路相逢。

definition: lit. to meet face to face on a narrow path (idiom)/fig. enemies or rivals meet face to face
lit. enemies on a narrow road (idiom); fig. an inevitable clash between opposing factions
desperate getaway (from a battlefield)/to cut a bloody path out of a battlefield
to diverge from the main road, also figuratively
destiny will make enemies meet (idiom)/(often said about lovers who have a disagreement)
pinyin: bu4 shi4 yuan1 jia1 bu4 ju4 tou2

definition: see 棋逢對手|棋逢对手[qi2 feng2 dui4 shou3]
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
lit. short-weaponed soldiery fight one another (idiom); fierce hand-to-hand infantry combat/to fight at close quarters
